com.jmex.physics.material
Class Material

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.material.Material

public class Material
extends java.lang.Object

A material specifies contact and mass details about a collision geometry or physics node.

Author:
Irrisor
See Also:
PhysicsCollisionGeometry.setMaterial(Material), PhysicsNode.setMaterial(Material)

getContactHandlingDetails

public ContactHandlingDetails getContactHandlingDetails(Material contactMaterial)
Query contact details of this material with another material.

Parameters:
contactMaterial - the second material
Returns:
contact details if

putContactHandlingDetails

public void putContactHandlingDetails(Material contactMaterial,
                                      ContactHandlingDetails details)
Specify contact details like friction (mu), bouciness etc. for a material pair. You can specify default contact details for any unspecified contact partner by passing null as first parameter.
Not that specifying default contact details can lead to undesired behaviour as it depends on the implementation which material is queried upon contact of two different materials.

material1.getContactHandlingDetails( material2 )
could lead to different results than
material2.getContactHandlingDetails( material1 )
if only default contact details are set.

This can avoided by specifying contact details for a pair of materials. If contactMaterial parameter is not null the contact details are set for material1->material2 and material2->material1.

Parameters:
contactMaterial - contact material, null for setting default details
details - contact details for specified contact pair / default, null to clear

setSurfaceMotion

public void setSurfaceMotion(com.jme.math.Vector3f motion)
Surface motion - if set, the surface is assumed to be moving independently of the motion of the nodes. This is kind of like a conveyor belt running over the surface.

Parameters:
motion - this vector specifies the motion of the surface in geometry coordinate space. This results in a motion relative to the world rotation of the geometry but independent from the direction of the surface itself.

getSurfaceMotion

public com.jme.math.Vector3f getSurfaceMotion(com.jme.math.Vector3f store)
Parameters:
store - where to store the retrieved value (null to create a new vector)
Returns:
surface motion
See Also:
setSurfaceMotion(com.jme.math.Vector3f)
